name: Prepare the environment
description:
Fetch fresh data from the trunk
$ git checkout trunk
$ git pull origin trunk

Check if node_modules exist
$ pnpm install (if node_modules don't exist)

Optional steps:
$ jetpack install --root
$ jetpack install --all

Make sure that system composer version matches the monorepo.

name: Create "prerelease" Branch
description:
Create a new branch for the pre-release:
$ git checkout -b prerelease
$ git push -u origin HEAD

name: Generate Changelog
description:
Run the jetpack release command to generate changelog files:
$ jetpack release plugins/<plugin> changelog --<stability> --add-pr-num

name: Review Changelog Files
description:
Review generated CHANGELOG.md files and make edits if necessary.
Then commit the changes:
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Update changelog files"

name: Update the readme file
description:
Update the changelog in the readme.txt file
$ jetpack release plugins/<plugin> readme --<stability>

name: Verify Stable Tag
description:
Verify that the stable tag in readme remains unchanged.
This is important because we don't want to change the stable tag until we're sure we're ready to release.
$ git add projects/plugins/<plugin>/readme.txt
$ git commit -m "Update readme.txt changelog"
$ git push origin prerelease

name: Create a release Branch
description:
[1m[33mImportant:[39m[22m Wait for the GitHub Build action to finish!
And for any updated packages to be published (i.e., to Packagist).

On GitHub:
* Check the Actions tab
* Click on Build
* Find the build run for your prerelease branch.

Create a new branch for the release and push it to the origin
$ ./tools/create-release-branch.sh <plugin_monorepo_slug> <plugin_version>

Optional:
* Open release branch in the browser
* Open release pull request URL in the browser

name: Initialize a new plugin cycle
description:
Start a new plugin release cycle by updating the plugin's version numbers in the trunk.

$ git checkout prerelease
$ git fetch
$ git merge origin/trunk
$ ./tools/fixup-project-versions.sh
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Update project versions."
$ git push origin prerelease

name: Smoke Test
description: Open the plugin's /advanced page on WordPress.org and check if the new version is available.

name: Publish
description:
Update the stable tag in the readme.txt file to release the plugin on WordPress.org.
$ ./tools/stable-tag.sh <plugin_monorepo_slug>

[33m[1mImportant:[22m[39m
Wait for the GitHub Build action to finish before publishing!
